titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Litchfield family Papers
1809-1966
MS 385
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:17:42 -0400.

did.abstract:
Correspondence, papers, account books, genealogical data, maps, printed material, newspaper clippings, and photographs of various members of the Litchfield family, particularly Elisha Litchfield, his sons, Edwin Clark Litchfield, Elisha Cleveland Litchfield, Electus Backus Litchfield, and Erasmus Darwin Litchfield, Edwin's wife and children, Grace Hubbard Litchfield, Edward Hubbard Litchfield, Henry Percy Litchfield, and Grace Denio Litchfield. The collection is concerned mainly with the family's interests in railroads, coal mining, and real estate during the 1850s-70s.
To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: Litchfield family papers
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection is not processed. As part of a project conducted in 2019-20, archivist Elise Winks performed a high level survey of the collection and described it broadly in this preliminary finding aid.
